alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 8:27AM CST until February 19 at 7:55AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Roubidoux Creek Near Waynesville affecting Pulaski County. Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood -East Gate affecting Pulaski County. For the Roubidoux Creek...including Waynesville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Big Piney River...including Fort Leonard Wood - East Gate... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood - East Gate. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, water at the lower TA 250 Training Ground is two feet deep. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM CST Friday was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 13.3 feet this morning. It will then fall to 13.1 feet and begin rising again this morning. It will rise to 13.3 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.3 feet on 02/26/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM CST.
